channel.title: Ephesians on Scrollmapper Biblical Text Archive
channel.description: Recent content in Ephesians on Scrollmapper Biblical Text Archive

item.title: Ephesians - American Standard-ASV1901 (ASV)
item.description: [1:1] Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, to the saints that are at Ephesus, and the faithful in Christ Jesus: [1:2] Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. [1:3] Blessed be' the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places’ in Christ: [1:4] even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blemish before him in love:

item.title: Ephesians - Bible in Basic English (BBE)
item.description: [1:1] Paul, an Apostle of Christ Jesus by the purpose of God, to the saints who are at Ephesus, and those who have faith in Christ Jesus: [1:2] Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. [1:3] Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has given us every blessing of the Spirit in the heavens in Christ: [1:4] Even as he made selection of us in him from the first, so that we might be holy and free from all evil before him in love:

item.title: Ephesians - King James Version (KJV)
item.description: [1:1] Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus: [1:2] Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ. [1:3] Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ: [1:4] According as he hath chosen us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before him in love:

item.title: Ephesians - World English Bible (WEB)
Ephesians - Young's Literal Translation (YLT)
item.description: [1:1] Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, to the saints who are in Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus: [1:2] Grace to you, and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ! [1:3] Blessed `is’ the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who did bless us in every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ, [1:4] according as He did choose us in him before the foundation of the world, for our being holy and unblemished before Him, in love,
